name: Dead Man's Draw
description: Dead Man’s Draw is a simple and strategic game of luck and skill that boils down strategy gameplay into a single, tense decision.
minimum_requirements: OS: Windows 10 / 8 / 7 / Vista SP2 Processor:  Memory: 1 GB RAM Graphics: OpenGL 1.5 or Higher Compatible Video Card Storage: 200 MB available space Sound Card:  Additional Notes: 1024x768 and 16-bit or higher color depth required

reviews.review_text: I debated for a while whether I should give this a recommendation or not - and ultimately I have to say no, it doesn't deserve it.  This IS a great little card game and I really like the way it plays. Mechanically it works well once all the different card abilities have been unlocked, and I like how it eases new players in to the game. There is some strategic decision making to be had, and there is also a 'push your luck' aspect which mixes things up nicely. The graphics are good, but the pirate theme is pasted on.  There's two things that stop me giving this a recommendation:  1. There is no multiplayer. If this game had online multiplayer for 2 players I would not hesitate to recommend it. As it stands this omission makes the game feel a bit pricey for what it is.  2. Unbalanced AI. Far too many times the AI will manage to put together a combo that is just amazing (it's not uncommon to see a significant lead wiped out in one hand), or will draw in such a way that it doesn't make sense (for example sometimes the AI will stop drawing after 2 useless low value cards and bank them; this could be a strategic decision, but every time it happens the next card turned over would have made the AI Bust).   It all leads to too much frustration for what should be a fun time waster.

I bought the digital version of this back in 2014 when it came out. It's still fun to play today. So much fun, in fact, I bought the board game version just recently. Both the app and board game have their pros and cons, but the game design is solid, the artwork is great, and most importantly, they're both really fun to play. Highly recommended as a fun diversion. The PC app is particularly fun because of all of the things you unlock and variants that you end up playing to help keep the game play fresh. I just wish it had a multiplayer option and continued to be developed by Stardock.

[EN] A simple and well done card game based on luck and strategy. Nice music. Easy to learn. There is ten decks of cards at our disposal which have special abilities and additionally 18 traits you can choose from during a game. 60 tournaments add variety to the game. Short sessions – ideal if you’ve got only few spare minutes to play. Challenging as you progress. Unlocking all achievements is quite a challenge.  I recommend it especially on sale.  [PL] Prosta i całkiem nieźle zrobiona gra w karty, oparta na szczęściu i strategii. Przyjemna muzyka. Łatwa do nauki. Do dyspozycji jest 10 różnych kolorów talii ze specjalnymi właściwościami oraz 18 dodatkowych umiejętności, z których możemy wybierać podczas gry. 60 turniejów urozmaica naszą rozgrywkę. Krótkie sesje – idealne, jeśli masz tylko kilka minut, żeby pograć. Zdobycie wszystkich osiągnięć jest nie lada wyzwaniem.  Gra warta polecenia zwłaszcza w promocji.

A time killer, just realize there is NOTHING random about the cards. At one point you will play numbers instead of suits. You will notice that you are pulling 3 card doubles about 80% of the time. Let's see, 2 cards drawing a third, 7 numbers total. That's 2 cards of 7 that will cause a double and 5 cards that won't. Does it seem like you are playing those odds. Now add the 2 card doubles. This game also has tension builders that are not needed. You have to rush your discard pick because it moves right away. The computer's is figured before the graphics even shows but the screen pauses and slowly scolls like it is choosing at a relaxed pace. Creating what seems to be an unfair illusion because the computer does not need that relaxed pace. Now the 'Busted' graphic does get old but it is also creating tension. First, you are being told repeatedly that you have failed. Next, clicking the mouse should remove it and the cards, starting the next hand. It doesn't work, you have to press the mouse a second time to remove the cards. Thus you try to match the timing of the double click or wait for 'busted' to disappear on it's own. As that tension builds you are now button mashing thinking that will speed it up. One click should finish the process but they want that tension there. It helps the AI appear to be a tougher opponent. Actually the AI follows a pretty basic set of commands. In the end the Devs ruined the game by adding these things so I cannot recommend it.

I was sorry that this game's Kickstart for a physical tabletop version wasn't funded. This is such a fun and quite addictive card game. I am counting the moments until they add online multiplayer. If you enjoy card games and don't own this game. You are truly missing out on something special. I highly recommend this title. The game itself as well as it's interface for the windows version are top notch. No bugs, no freezes, no issues at all. The Dev's even posted that they would consider adding MP if there was enough interest. I hope everyone will post requesting it in the forums today.
If there would be a card edition, I would buy it immediately. This game is nothing for landlubbers.  Draw yer cards like a real pirate and rob the shark bait.   But I miss a multiplayer.
This is game of luck and the odds are not in your favor. It can be very frustrating after a short time.
10/10  would unintentionally screw self over again
Really enjoy this game no skill just look lol. Nice game for low price. Liking card games this was enjoyable for me. Hope others may enjoy it as well.
Just... one... more... round... Oh is that sunrise outside?
It's a fun little time waster, good pickup in a sale or bundle.

Simple card game, akin to WAR where higher card wins.  If you double up with 2 cards from the same suit you Bust & lose your hand. This happens MUCH too frequently for the game to be fun. The AI will bust as often as you do, but this just adds to the shoulder shrug interest level.  Ho-hum...even for the $2.49 current sale price I would pass.
The most confusing game of cards I've ever played.  Also good job stealing The Pirates of the Caribbean theme song a*sholes!  2/10
Very fun and addictive, perfect game for my tablet playing. The levels become progressively more challenging to achieve the three stars.
Probably the most interesting card game I've ever played.  YAR HAR AHOY AND AVAST, BEING A PIRATE IS REALLY BADASS! HANG THE BLACK FLAG AT THE EDGE OF THE MAST!

A great push-your-luck type card game with a lot of interesting twists mixed into the core gameplay to keep it fresh. Even though there's no multiplayer (in a game made for it), the AI is at least challenging and even ♥♥♥♥♥♥♥ fair in its plays. If you'll never find any use out of a physical version, pick up this for a good game to play in your downtime.

Initially, this was a thumbs up review...  In the beginning, I was very impressed with this game. It's a bit complicated to understand the mechanics, but once you got an idea of how everything works together and what combos are possible, it starts to get really entertaining. BUT: DMD gets frustrating in late game. Reason? The AI is balanced in early ~, but I'd prefer it if they failed drawing as much cards as I do. No matter what I do, AI always gets the needed card to win on the river. Made me uninstall it, because it really makes no sense to play when anything I do is getting countered on the last card. Tried for like 100 times. 100 times last card win.   Call it bad luck? Maybe. I call dips on bad balancing.
This is a great, engrossing game. The AI does cheat sometimes and that can be quite frustrating, but its still a great game.
Great and simple card game.

I got this game on sale for $2.50 and it turned out to be a really fun game, once you get the hang of it. It's basically a card game, with different suits of cards granting different abilities to the player. It definitely takes skill and a mind for strategy, but there is also an element of luck involved. Overall, it's been very entertaining though.

Dead Man's Draw is a slick and polished head-to-head card game, played against an AI opponent. The rule-set is initially very simple, with more rules and features introduced as the player progresses, providing a smooth introduction to the finer points of playing the game.   As with many card games, luck plays an enormous factor in your success or failure, but there is also a significant degree of skill that can be applied to influence the outcome of a game.   A single round of the game takes only a minute or two, meaning that this is an excellent 'filler game' for when you only have 5 minutes to play something quickly. That said, there's a reasonably long campaign-style progression, which continually offers new opponents with various abilities and tweaks to the rules to keep things interesting over many hours of gameplay, and it's easy to get sucked into 'one more round'.   Overall, it's a splendid little game.

Really fun game. Luck based, like everyone says, but most IRL card games are so it's not an issue for me. I like to open it up and play in between other games. It's fun :) I would definitely wait until it's on sale, though.
I would say the game is about equal parts skill and luck; but it is a fun game, and it's nice to have a card game that isn't a reworking of an existing real world card game.

Quick, satisfying little game. I have a stimulus-demanding attention span and this is perfect to play while eating breakfast or listening to podcasts. The theme is fun, jaunty, clever and chaotic.  This is probably also a good one for young game designers to study, since it's quite elegant the way the tutorial builds through the game, how the elements interact, and how one novel element is all that's needed to sustain a lot of attention.
